results.title: La Marseillaise
results.creator_credit: Jean Renoir, Andre Seigneur and La Compagnie Jean Renoir
results.brief_description: Renoir financed “La Marseillaise” entirely from public subscription. The film traces the fortunes of two young men during the French Revolution. Renoir’s characteristic warmth and faith in human nature is prominent, and he concentrates on portraying the lives of ordinary people during the revolutionary period. This is one of the few great films to deal seriously with this momentous time in history.

results.title: Les Liaisons Dangereuses
results.creator_credit: Roger Vadim, Leopold Schlossberg, Astor Productions and Films Marceau
results.brief_description: Roger Vadim up-dates Choderlos de Laclos’ 18th century novel to present day France. Valmont (Gerard Philipe) and Juliette (Jeanne Moreau) turn love and sex into a game, and in doing so make victims of those who fall for their seductive manipulations. However in their attempt to corrupt the innocent Marianne, love threatens to destroy all the players of the game. The cast also includes Jean-Louis Trintignant. The jazz score is by Thelonious Monk and the excellent photography is by Marcel Grignon.

results.title: Abbott and Costello in Hollywood
results.creator_credit: S. Sylvan Simon, Martin A. Gosch, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Abbott and Costello play a pair of barbers who want their own Hollywood barber shop and to get it no two barbers have ever been in more close shaves. There’s Abbott-the-schemer who gets them jobs as big-time talent agents. Then there’s Costello, all he’s ever headed for is trouble. When Abbott and Costello get inside Hollywood, Hollywood gets turned inside out.

results.title: San Francisco
results.creator_credit: W S. Van Dyke, Bernard H. Hyman, John Emerson and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A lavish production set in San Francisco, in which Clark Gable plays the role of Blackie Norton, proprietor of a riotous saloon. When Jeanette MacDonald arrives on the scene in search of a singing career, they fall in love. The climax takes place amongst the recreation of the great earthquake that hit the city in 1906. Cast also includes Spencer Tracy, Jack Holt, Jessie Ralph and Ted Healy. Screenplay by Anita Loos from the story by Robert Hopkins. Edited by Tom Neld.

results.title: The Hustler
results.creator_credit: Robert Rossen and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Paul Newman is Fast Eddie Felson, the fastest-talking, sharpest-shooting pool shark in town. The film traces his struggle to gain the World Championship from the reigning pool king, Minnesota Fats (Jackie Gleason). Newman’s Fast Eddie symbolises the struggle of the down-and-out in America. The film features exceptional black and white photography (the cinematography won an Academy Award), and a witty, literate script based on the novel by Walter Tevis.

results.title: Delius: Ken Russell's Song of Summer
results.brief_description: Based on Eric Fenby’s book, “Delius As I Knew Him”, Russell’s film follows the events of the five bizarre years Fenby spent in France assisting the aging composer when he was paralysed and almost totally blind. The Delius household proved to be a law unto itself but was an environment where some of the composer’s greatest works were created, including “A Song of Summer”. After the death of Delius, Fenby went on to become Professor of Harmony at the Royal Academy of Music in London.

results.title: Anne of Green Gables (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Kevin Sullivan, Ian McDougall and Sullivan Films
results.brief_description: Artistically filmed amidst the spectacular scenery of Prince Edward Island, Canada, this award winning movie follows the provocative life drama of Anne Shirley, an endearing orphan, from her struggles as an adolescent to her triumphs as a young woman. Based on the novel “Anne of Green Gables” by Lucy Maud Montgomery, it stars Megan Follows and Colleen Dewhurst.

results.title: The Seven year itch
results.creator_credit: Billy Wilder, Charles K. Feldman and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A husband of seven years, alone in New York while his family is on vacation, fantasises an affair with the TV model in the upstairs apartment and develops “The seven year itch”. Tortured by guilt, he envisions so many dire consequences that he finally runs off to join his wife. Tom Ewell and Marilyn Monroe star in this tremendous comedy. Based on the play by George Axelrod.

results.title: Ethics and the Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journalism Resource Tapes”.
Creighton Burns, Editor of the Age and Harry Gordon, former Editor in Chief of the Herald and Weekly Times, discuss issues relating to journalism’s code of ethics. They discuss what their in-house rules are relating to ethics and integrity within their journalistic world.

results.title: The Grass is singing
results.creator_credit: Michael Raeburn, Mark Forstater, Chibote Ltd and Svenska filminstitutet
results.brief_description: Set against the overwhelming African bush, Karen Black as Mary Turner plays a desperate woman searching for security and love. Unable to come to terms with herself or the land she lives in, Mary accepts a marriage proposal from farmer John Thaw, rather than remain single in a big city. But this is not the escape she hoped it to be. Based on the novel by Doris Lessing.
